title: Englishpod 初级 英文播客 0002

segments.en: Hello, English learners, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
I'm Amira.
Amira and I are here today with another interesting and useful lesson for you English learners.
segments.cn: Amira和我今天为你们英语学习者带来另一个有趣且实用的课程。

segments.en: Amira, why don't you explain a little bit of what this lesson is about today?
segments.cn: Amira，你能简单解释一下今天的课程内容吗？

segments.en: It's about calling in sick.
Oh, okay.
That's useful.
Yes, definitely.
It happens to everyone once in a while, you don't feel so well, or you feel well but you don't want to go to work.
segments.cn: 每个人偶尔都会遇到这种情况，感觉不太好，或者感觉不错但不想去上班。

segments.en: Right.
So you call in sick.
Okay, okay.
Let's listen to this dialogue.
And I want everyone to keep their ears open and see if the boss believes this person.
segments.cn: 我希望大家保持耳朵灵敏，看看老板是否相信这个人。

segments.en: Let's listen.
Hello, Daniel speaking.
How may I help you?
Hi, Daniel.
Julie here.
Oh, hi, Julie.
How are you?
Actually, I'm feeling quite ill today.
segments.cn: 其实，我今天感觉很不舒服。

segments.en: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
What's wrong?
I think I'm coming down with the flu.
I have a headache, a sore throat, a runny nose, and I'm feeling slightly feverish.
segments.cn: 我头痛，喉咙痛，流鼻涕，感觉有点发热。

segments.en: I see.
So you're calling in sick.
Yes, I was hoping to take the day off to recover.
segments.cn: 是的，我希望请一天假来恢复。

segments.en: Okay, then.
Try and get some rest.
Marco, do you think he believed her?
No, I don't think he believed her.
He didn't sound really convinced.
Yes, and Julie didn't sound really sick, huh?
segments.cn: 是的，Julie听起来也不太像生病了，嗯？

segments.en: Exactly.
Well, we have some really good vocabulary here.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们这里有一些非常好的词汇。

segments.en: Amira, why don't you begin with the first one?
The first phrase I've chosen for you is a very, very useful one.
segments.cn: 我为你选择的第一个短语是一个非常非常有用的。

segments.en: I'm feeling quite ill today.
I'm feeling quite ill today.
I'm feeling quite ill today.
Alright, what does this mean exactly?
segments.cn: 好吧，这到底是什么意思？

segments.en: It means that she's feeling sick.
segments.cn: 这意味着她感觉生病了。

segments.en: Oh, okay, that's clear.
So she is sick.
She's feeling sick.
Okay, let's look at another really useful phrase, and this one is I'm coming down with the flu.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看另一个非常有用的短语，这个是我得了流感。

segments.en: I'm coming down with the flu.
I'm coming down with the flu.
I'm coming down with the flu.
Alright, and this phrase means that I am starting to get the flu, or I am getting the flu.
segments.cn: 好吧，这个短语的意思是我开始得流感，或者我正在得流感。

segments.en: Okay, the next phrase I have for you is calling in sick.
segments.cn: 好的，下一个短语是请病假。

segments.en: Calling in sick.
It means calling your boss to tell him that you can't come to work today.
segments.cn: 这意味着打电话给你的老板告诉他你今天不能来上班。

segments.en: I personally love this phrase because it saves so much time and explanations.
segments.cn: 我个人非常喜欢这个短语，因为它节省了很多时间和解释。

segments.en: Okay, perfect.
So if I say this, then everyone will know that I am not coming to work today.
segments.cn: 所以如果我这样说，大家就会知道我今天不来上班。

segments.en: Yes, definitely.
Perfect.
Alright, and the last phrase that we're going to take a look at today is I was hoping to take the day off.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们要看的最后一个短语是我希望请一天假。

segments.en: I was hoping to take the day off.
I was hoping to take the day off.
I was hoping to take the day off.
Right, and she says this to ask for permission because she does not want to go to work.
segments.cn: 对，她这样说是为了请求许可，因为她不想去上班。

segments.en: Okay, now couldn't she just say, like, I can't come today?
segments.cn: 好吧，她难道不能直接说，我今天不能来吗？

segments.en: Right, she could say I can't come today, but that would be a little bit impolite.
segments.cn: 对，她可以说我今天不能来，但那会有点不礼貌。

segments.en: Okay, so when she says I was hoping to take the day off, it's a polite way of asking.
segments.cn: 好的，所以当她说我希望请一天假时，这是一种礼貌的请求方式。

segments.en: It's a polite way, exactly, because she is talking to her boss.
segments.cn: 这是一种礼貌的方式，正是因为她在和她的老板说话。

segments.en: Very good.
So let's listen to the dialogue one more time.
segments.cn: 所以让我们再听一次对话。

segments.en: The dialogue is a little different this time.
Listen carefully and see if you think the boss believes her this time.
segments.cn: 仔细听，看看你认为老板这次相信她吗。

segments.en: Hello, Daniel speaking.
How may I help you?
Hi, Daniel.
Julie here.
Oh, hi, Julie.
How are you?
Actually, I'm feeling quite ill today.
segments.cn: 其实，我今天感觉很不舒服。

segments.en: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.
What's wrong?
I think I'm coming down with the flu.
I have a headache, a sore throat, a runny nose, and I'm feeling slightly feverish.
segments.cn: 我头痛，喉咙痛，流鼻涕，感觉有点发热。

segments.en: I see.
So are you calling in sick?
Yes, I was hoping to take the day off to recover.
segments.cn: 是的，我希望请一天假来恢复。

segments.en: Okay, then.
Try and get some rest.
Okay, guys, we're back.
And I do think he believed her this time.
Yeah, I think he was understanding when he said, okay, then try and get some rest.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得他在说好的，尝试休息一下时很理解。

segments.en: Yeah, and Julie sounded pretty sick.
segments.cn: 是的，Julie听起来真的很生病。

segments.en: Yes, yes, she did.
Yeah, it was convincing.
Well, you know what?
I almost called in sick last week.
Really?
Yeah, I wasn't feeling very well, and so I almost didn't come to work.
segments.cn: 是的，我感觉不太好，所以差点没来上班。

segments.en: Oh, that would have been really bad for me.
segments.cn: 哦，那对我来说真的很糟糕。

segments.en: I would have been stuck here without you, Marco.
segments.cn: 如果没有你，我就得呆在这里，Marco。

segments.en: Yeah, you would have had to do the podcast all by yourself.
segments.cn: 是的，你得一个人做播客。

segments.en: Oh, no.
You know, actually, I had the same symptoms as Julie.
segments.cn: 你知道吗，实际上我和Julie有相同的症状。

segments.en: I also had a headache and I had a sore throat.
And also, the worst thing and the thing that I hate the most is I had a runny nose.
segments.cn: 而且，最糟糕的事情是我流鼻涕。

segments.en: Oh, no, that's really bad because then you have to like blow your nose all the time and then it gets red and it hurts, right?
segments.cn: 哦，不，这真的很糟糕，因为你得一直擤鼻涕，然后鼻子变红还疼，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly, yeah.
Luckily, I didn't have a fever, though.
Oh, thank God.
Yeah.
So did you take some medicine and it just killed everything?
segments.cn: 那你吃了药，结果就好了？

segments.en: Yeah, I had a friend and he had some pills for the flu and he just gave me a couple and I felt better in about two days.
segments.cn: 是的，我有个朋友，他有流感药，他给了我几颗，我大约两天后感觉好多了。

segments.en: Oh, great.
Well, so guys, let me tell you about a very funny thing that really happens in real life in Egypt.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，让我告诉你们一个在埃及真实发生的非常有趣的事情。

segments.en: What story do you have for us today?
segments.cn: 今天你有什么故事要分享？

segments.en: Well, it's actually not a story.
It's a fact.
I mean, people in Egypt, when they're sick, they never call in sick themselves.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，埃及人生病时，从来不会自己请病假。

segments.en: They'll have someone do that for them.
segments.cn: 他们会让别人帮他们请假。

segments.en: Oh, that's interesting.
Why?
Why do they do this?
Well, there's this weird speculation about, you know, if you can make it to the phone, you can make it to the office.
segments.cn: 嗯，有一种奇怪的推测，就是如果你能打电话，你就能到办公室。

segments.en: Ah, I agree.
I agree.
If I were a boss, I would do the same thing.
segments.cn: 如果我是老板，我也会这样做。
